page.title: 10A childs life-Rawdon-School
page.content: This account of a typical childs life is based on a survey of 150 children at Rawdon C.E. Most wake at between 7 and 8 ,wash,dress and have a cereal breakfast,then clean their teeth and go to school.Just over half walk less than a mile to school,the rest go by car.After morning assembly favourite lessons include mathematics and english,but P.E. is the most popular. In Autumn football and netball are enjoyed but as soon as the snow arrives sliding and building snowmen is popular.In Spring the children play marbles and skipping,but Summer brings cricket and rounders.At lunch time the favourite foods are salad,fish and chips and sausages and beefburgers.15% of the children bring a packed lunch. Two thirds of the children in school play a musical instrument-at school or at a music centre.
